intro: Cyrtandra ternaria, commonly known as the three-parted heliconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its striking, bird-of-paradise-like inflorescences, which consist of brightly colored bracts surrounding clusters of small, tubular flowers. Cyrtandra ternaria typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
